description:
This is the third installment of the series of graphic novels based on the daily comic strip, Evil Inc. This is not simply a collection of comic strips. Rather, I take the individual panels of the strips and lay out a continuous graphic novel. Since I do a storyline-driven comic, it reads smoothly from cover to cover, and since it's based on a daily humor strip, reading it in one volume lends it a rapid-fire sense of humor.

Annual Report Vol. 3 picks up where Vol. 2 left off -- the establishment of the Evil Inc Day Care -- and includes all of the storylines through Lightning Lady and the Memo discovering Dr. Haynus' plan to topple Evil Inc (which is controlled by Captain Heroic).

Included in this volume:

-- How Cap met Miss Match

-- Capt. Heroic takes over Evil Inc

-- Evil Atom at the Vulture Lodge

-- Nemmie Awards / Origin of Evil Atom

-- Lightning Lady and Miss Match stage a bank heist for charity

-- The Oldest Living Henchman retires

-- Origin of Dr. Haynus

-- Cal Cornley, Gossip Columnist to the super-powered community
name: Volume 3

description:
This is the fourth installment of the series of graphic novels based on the daily comic strip, Evil Inc. This is not simply a collection of comic strips. Rather, I take the individual panels of the strips and lay out a continuous graphic novel. Since I do a storyline-driven comic, it reads smoothly from cover to cover, and since it's based on a daily humor strip, reading it in one volume lends it a rapid-fire sense of humor.

The story: In this volume, Captain Heroic finds himself named the CEO of Evil Inc with a mandate to curtail the company's evil commerce without losing money. As if that isn't enough:

--A mysterious new villain makes his ominous presence known.

-- A plot to blow up the Evil Inc building is uncovered.

-- Cap's 5-year-old son is kidnapped.
name: Volume 4

description: As with all of the Annual Report books, this is a graphic novelization of the daily comic strip -- with the individual panels of the strips designed into a continuously narrative graphic novel. Some of the content in the book has not appeared anywhere online. It's 96 pages of full-color fun.
name: Volume 5

description: As with all of the Annual Report books, this is a graphic novelization of the daily comic strip -- with the individual panels of the strips designed into a continuously narrative graphic novel. Some of the content in the book has not appeared anywhere online. It's 104 pages of full-color fun.
name: Volume 6

description: As with all of the Evil Inc graphic novels, the individual panels of the daily comic strip are combined with extra original content and re-designed into a continuous narrative. Some of the content in the book has not appeared anywhere online. It's 128 pages of full-color fun.
name: Volume 7

description: Alan Moore's Miracleman predated Watchmen and Dark Knight as the first of the grim, ultra-realistic strips that changed super-hero comics forever. But whatever happened to Miracleman? For the first time, this trade paperback tells all the behind-the-scenes secrets, from the character's start as the British strip Marvelman, to the legal and creative hurdles during its 24-issue run at Eclipse Comics, and why you never saw the final Neil Gaiman-scripted issue! Sporting a Mark Buckingham cover and an introduction and back cover by Alex Ross, this book features in-depth interviews with Alan Moore, John Totleben, Neil Gaiman, Mark Buckingham, Barry Windsor-Smith, Beau Smith, Cat Yronwode, Rick Veitch, and others! Plus there's an amazing assortment of unpublished art, uninked pencils, sketches, and concept drawings (including unseen art from the never-published issue #25) by Totleben, Windsor-Smith, Buckingham, Mike Deodato, Jim Lee, Todd McFarlane, and more! Also includes a never-before-published eight-page Moore/Totleben story, "Lux Brevis," and an unused Moore script! (A percentage of profits go to Miracleman artist John Totleben, who is battling the eye disease Retinitus Pigmentosa.)

At 256 pages, Al Williamson's Flash Gordon: A Lifelong Vision of the Heroic collects all the major works of the artist featuring Flash Gordon - Williamson's the legendary King Comics stories from the 1960s, the 1980 adaptation of the Universal Flash Gordon motion picture, and the Marvel Comics miniseries of 1994. In addition, the volume features Williamson's Flash drawings done for commercial illustration and prints, his assists on the Flash Gordon comic strip, a variety of images for amateur publications, and a selection of largely unpublished images spanning his interest in the character from childhood to the conclusion of his career. Available in Hardcover and Softcover editions.
name: HC/TPB

volume.name: Al Williamson's Flash Gordon, A Lifelong Vision of the Heroic

person_credits.name: Jim Davis
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Evil Inc is a corporation run for super-villains *by* super-villains... because you can do more evil if you do it legal. This monthly comic collects all of the weekday comic strips for June 2012. In this issue, a super-hero masquerades as Lightning Lady, ruining her hard-won reputation as a self-respecting nemesis.
name: Unstrung Hero

description: This issue of Evil Inc Monthly collects all of the weekday comic strip for July 2012 -- plus additional bonus content from the Evil Inc Archive. Evil Inc is a corporation run for super-villains, by super-villains. In this episode, Lightning Lady attempts to regain her villainous reputation after a hero does good deeds masquerading as her. Plus two comic-convention-themed storylines in honor of Comic Con International ... AND the return of the Buccanette!
name: Unstrung hero Pt 2

description: This month features the beginning of an epic space adventure starring Miss Match, Lightning Lady and Desdemona -- with Captain Scarr (the "Buccanette") at the helm. Also included is a story from the Evil Inc Archive: Death Fog audits Evil Inc departments, looking for places to cut the budget, and he discovers the department responsible for re-acclimating villains who have returned from the dead.
name: Space Pirates

description: This month features the conclusion of an epic space adventure that started last month, starring Miss Match, Lightning Lady and Desdemona -- with Captain Scarr (the "Buccanette") at the helm. Also included in this edition is a special sneak-peek at the new Evil Inc graphic novel, "Evil Inc: When Worlds Collide," available now
name: Space Pirates Pt 2

description: In this issue, Captain Heroic faces his daddy issues, and the Real Housewives of Transylvania are introduced. Also included in this edition is a Tale from the Evil Inc Archive that re-lives the death of an old nemesis, Mister Shiver -- but not before one of the best intro sequences in Evil Inc history!
name: The Real Housewives of Transylvania

description: In this issue, 10-year-old Oscar's life takes center stage, and then Evil Atom meets a Djinn in a bar. Finally, the Mind Games storyline kicks off -- can Dr. Haynus and Dr. Muskiday successfully attach a mind-control device to Captain Heroic? (And if they do, what should they make him do?!) Also included in this edition is a Tale from the Evil Inc Archive special: The Best of Oscar, featuring some of the best comics featuring the son of Captain Heroic and Miss Match.
name: Mind Games

description:
In this issue, the Mind Games storyline from last month concludes. Dr. Haynus and Dr. Muskiday have attached a mind-control device to Captain Heroic. But Cap doesn't know that -- and neither does the smitten Amazing Amazon.

Also included in this edition is a Tale from the Evil Inc Archive special: A story from the past of Cap's father, Commander Heroic. What will he do when an old flame threatens the life his son has made with the villainous Miss Match.
name: Mind Games Pt 2

description: This month, Captain Heroic takes his family on a holiday road trip. In the bonus section, Tales from the Evil Inc Archives, Captain Heroic, disguised as Dark Hood, finds himself in charge of Evil Inc. Can he run it scrupulously without running it into the ground? This is the storyline that leaves the company in shambles. Literally.
name: Road Trip

description: This month, a special multi-part storyline kicks off when a parallel-universe Miss Match appears with the following statement: "If you don't come with me, your son may die." This begins a story that will leave Captain Heroic, Miss Match, and their unique blended family, changed forever. PLUS: A special feature pulled from the Evil Inc Archive.
name: One of the Family Pt 1

description: Watson and Holmes continue from last issue to find Shon's missing girlfriend, and more clues to a bigger mystery and danger than expected.

name: Rich Or Poor, I Love You

description:
NOW WITH MORE STORY PER ISSUE!

As the snow outside deepens and the team members continue to reveal their secrets to one another, Ananti tells Ian what happened to her loved ones and how she survived the zombie apocalypse.

volume.name: The Last Zombie: Before the After

description: Sergeant Warner demands the best from the people under his command, but what does he demand of himself? As the blizzard ends, the demons that drive Warner are finally revealed. But what of Ian's secrets? Is Doctor Federman about to discover the truth about them?

volume.name: The Last Zombie: Before the After

name: One Moon, One Star, One Love

description: Brianna's man Zan is firmly in the clutches of the savage, tropical giants of mystic Ooshoosh Island, imperiled by sacrifice in a deadly "Smooshing" ritual! His partner (and Gina's current squeeze), Nez, is studying the tribe and is sure Zan will be perfectly safe. --Brianna and Gina load up on whatever they can get to fight off an island of thirty-foot-tall, amorous, psychotic nymphomaniacs! An over-the-top, tongue-in-cheek humor issue.

name: I Was A Good Time Girl
